CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1969, pg. 6 reads: "Zion Conf. Devotees - Individuals, who were personally responsible for the financial success of the recent Allegheny AME Zion Conference session, at John Wesley Church receive a word of congratulations [sic] from Mrs. Marion Leonard, left, of Berkeley, Cal., who cam back to visit her home conference here.  Mrs. Bertha Austin, in wheel-chair, who has been a conference worker for may years, has never failed to raise the amount required of her, in spite of her handicap   Others, reading from left, are, Mrs. Nellie Bryant of Jeannette, crowned Home Mission Queen; Mrs. Martha Franklin, banner registration solicitor and Mother Elizabeth Bell of Carnegie, who reported $146 as a conference worker, instead of the $25 assessed. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Marion Leonard, Bertha Austin seated in wheelchair, Nellie Bryant, Martha Franklin, and Elizabeth Bell, posed near stairs in Wesley Center AME Zion Church
